title: NLCD Land Cover (1992–2021) — Kansas
description: National Land Cover Database (NLCD) categorical land-cover rasters clipped to Kansas for years 1992, 2001, 2006, 2011, 2016, 2019, and 2021. Enables time-aware analyses of grassland→cropland→urban transitions and supports overlays with soils, hydrology, and historical layers.

classification.palette_note: Use standard NLCD symbology to preserve interpretability across years.

endpoints.notes: MRLC/USGS download pages provide GeoTIFFs; if using the bulk/tiles API or AWS cache, list the direct TIFF URLs per year in a local manifest.

steps: Download NLCD GeoTIFF for each target year (CONUS coverage).
Clip to Kansas bbox (-102.05,36.99,-94.61,40.00) using gdalwarp (categorical resampling=nearest).
Convert each clipped raster to Cloud-Optimized GeoTIFF (COG) with internal overviews.
Optionally build a VRT or a STAC Items collection to expose the time slider (one item per year).
processing.crs_note: NLCD is typically in Albers Equal Area; clipping in source CRS then translating to COG is fine for web use. Keep categorical resampling=nearest.

lineage: Downloaded NLCD GeoTIFFs from MRLC/USGS per year.
Converted to COG; built internal overviews; preserved categorical class values.
notes: Aligns with platform’s land-cover/hydrology layer plan and STAC cataloging for time-aware layers. For higher-resolution local studies, pair with Kansas GAP (2001) or Ecological Systems (2017–2018) noted in the audit.
